alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:27PM EDT until May 27 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL OCEAN...SOUTHEASTERN HUNTERDON...NORTHEASTERN MERCER...SOMERSET...MONMOUTH AND MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 427 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Belle Mead to Twin Rivers to Jacksons Mills, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Asbury Park, Somerville, Somerset, Edison, Lakewood, Old Bridge, Jackson, Howell, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Sayreville, North Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Middlesex and Princeton. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 12. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 36 and 41. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 34. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 17. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 96 and 132. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
